title: Which Helvetica is this?
content:
Hello,  
Can someone help to identify which sans serif this is?  
I think probably a version of Helvetica but not sure which one?  
Thanks in advance for the help!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053425im_/http:/typophile.com/files/josef_bauer_440x280_umschlag_6616.pdf-1.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053425im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1404787_852257208138532_4918021114599878039_o_6489.jpg)

Font: 

 Linotype Helvetica Neue 

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053425/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [josef\_bauer\_440x280\_umschlag.pdf-1.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053425/http:/typophile.com/files/josef_bauer_440x280_umschlag.pdf-1.jpg) | 279.7 KB |
author: takashikato78

comments.content: For cover, I suggest Linotype [Helvetica Neue](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317053425/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/neue-helvetica). looks the closest to me (/1 top bar length, /t foot curvature and crossbar length...). Couldn't tell for the body text but still 'Helvetica'.
Thanks Ryuk. I think this is correct! I think the body must be the same.
